artifacts.title: POEM — SIMULCAST, 1997 (excerpted transmission)
artifacts.excerpt: The past wasn’t remembered — it was transmitted. Station ID burns in. Weather lies politely. The rerun arrives early.
artifacts.body:
# SIMULCAST, 1997

The past wasn’t remembered — it was **transmitted**.

A station ID loops until it becomes a prayer.
Weather updates arrive **days ahead** of the sky.
Ads sell you a feeling you haven’t had yet.

We call it archival.
But it’s rehearsal.

And somewhere behind the CRT glow,
**the city learns your name**
by repeating it wrong.

artifacts.title: POEM — Door To Nowhere (Threshold Notes)
artifacts.excerpt: A door that opens into maintenance light. A hallway that remembers you. A map that edits itself when you look away.
artifacts.body:
# Door To Nowhere (Threshold Notes)

A door that opens into **maintenance light**.
A hallway that remembers you.

Blueprints say *no*.
The wall says *almost*.

You step once.
The floor corrects your story.

Somewhere, a stairwell keeps going
**after the building stops**.
